title: Java ScanneruseDelimiter()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java ScanneruseDelimiter()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Read comma separated items:
// Create a scanner object
Scanner myObj = new Scanner("Item 1,Item 2,Item 3");

// Change delimiter
myObj.useDelimiter(",");

// Read the contents of the scanner
while (myObj.has
  System.out.println(myObj.
}
Definition and Usage
The
useDelimiter()
method changes the delimiter used by the scanner. A delimiter is the sequence of characters which separates tokens in the data being scanned. It is described by a regular expression given by a string or a
Pattern
object.
Learn more about regular expressions in our
Java RegEx tutorial
.
What is a token?
A token is a sequence of characters separated from other tokens by delimiters. The default delimiter is a block of whitespace characters but it can be changed with this method.
Syntax
One of the following:
public Scanner useDelimiter(Pattern
pattern
)
public Scanner useDelimiter(String
pattern
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
pattern
Required. A string or
Pattern
object. A regular expression defining which sequences of characters are considered delimiters.
Technical Details
Returns:
A reference to the
Scanner
object that this method belongs to, which allows for chaining configuration methods. An example of chaining is
myObj.useDelimiter(",").setRadix(16);
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Java ScanneruseDelimiter()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java ScanneruseDelimiter()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java ScanneruseDelimiter()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
